Text:
It has been a while since the attack on the kingdom's
prestigious Midgar Academy for Dark Knights by a
group claiming to be Shadow Garden...

To repair the destroyed facilities, the academy was
issued an earlier than usual summer break, giving
the students time to pack up their things.
...Whew.

It's been quiet, as expected. The students who were
quick to pack up their belongings have already left
the academy.

The academy that was once so beautiful is now...
We must destroy the Cult of Diablosâ€”
Nu?
...Y-Yes!
What're you doing here?
I'm on a mission.

We've been ordered to search for any traces of
the group that...attacked the academy.
Now it all makes sense.

Master Shadow...I mean, Master Cid, did you stop by
to pick up that luggage?
Yeah, you could say that.

You were about to leave, weren't you?
I apologize for keeping you.

Oh, no worries at all. There's nothing for me to do
when I go home anyway.
I see... Would you like to walk with me for a bit?
She blurts it out without even thinking.

(If I didn't have to leave my family as a possessed,
I would've still been at the dark knight academy...)

(I could've studied at the same academy as Shadow...
I mean, Master Cid... I could've enjoyed my time a bit
more, right?)

(If Lady Gamma finds out, she might scold me for not
devoting myself to the mission...)
Go for a walk...?
Y-Yes, as part of the mission, of course.

I think we'll stand out less if we walk around the
academy together. What do you think?

That is an excuse. Even if only for a moment, she is
nervous about Master Shadow's response.

Sure, that sounds good. I don't have any plans later
on anyway.

I apologize for asking you so suddenly, but thank you
very much.

She thanks him, but can't say she had accepted this
mission in hopes of seeing him.

(Otherwise, I wouldn't have walked all the way into
Master Shadow's line of sight.)

If you didn't have luggage with you, Master Shadow,
I would've asked you to escort me.
Is that so?

Realism is the most important thing when it comes
to infiltration, but I give up this time. Let's...go to
the auditorium first.
Alright.
It's horrendous, isn't it?

Yeah, awful. It seems the group is also responsible
for indiscriminate murders, kidnapping, arson, and
robberies.
It's an organization called Shadow Garden.
Master Shadow states this plainly.
I see... Have you seen the wanted notice?
Yeah, they're posted everywhere.

How can they display something full of lies like that
when they haven't even repaired the building yet?
Well, whatever. You don't have to worry about it.

They take a look around the auditorium, which is
still scarred with damage.

The Knight Order has finished its survey of the major
areas, and there are no traces of the Cult of Diablos
to be found except for the destroyed buildings.
Do you want to check out the laboratory too?
Can we go in there...?
Yeah, probably. We are students after all.

(True, we are students...and even if they thought we
were fake students, they probably wouldn't accuse
us of anything.)

However...during the incident, the laboratory was
completely ravaged.

The fire destroyed a valuable collection of books,
and there's likely nothing else left...

I-I sincerely apologize. I didn't mean to argue
with you...

...But why did you make such a suggestion? You must
certainly know everything I said just now.
I just thought you wanted to go there.
What?! Me?!
Yeah...hmm?
Oh, um...why did you think so?
That's where the members of the Crimson Order fell.

Huh? Oh yeah, that's right. I was with you when the incident
happened, Master Cid.

The corpse of Glen the Lion's Mane was there along
with Marco Granger, who was unconscious.
Marco Granger was your former fiancÃ©, right?
Yes.
I thought you would be curious.
No, not at all.
I've already put the past behind me...

(I truly don't think anything of Marco Granger
anymore.)
(But...I haven't forgotten all of my past yet...)

(That's why I want to feel like the student I should
have been, but I still have my regrets...)

I'm sorry to have caused you unnecessary
distress, Master Cid.

It must've been plainly obvious that I haven't been
able to let go of the past... I will be more careful.
I see.

There are some things we don't want, so we throw them
away. But there are also things that we can't let go of.

Well, no matter what, there are things you just can't
get rid of. I think it's good to cherish those.
Ah...

When I joined Shadow Garden, I was ready to
leave everything in the past behind.
(But maybe I don't need to throw anything away...)
(For example...if I hold it secretly in my heart...)
Do I have to throw it away to move forward?
I guess it's up to the individual.
It's up to me...
...Heehee, yeah, you might be right.
(I'm the one who decides my future.)

(I'm still not sure, but with the help of Master
Shadow and the others, I'll be able toâ€”)
What's wrong?
Um...

Maybe it's just my imagination, but I thought you
looked like you'd had an epiphany.
I-I see...

(I cannot hide anything from him. No matter what I do,
he still knows my deepest thoughts.)
Did you know, Master Cid?
My name "Nu" means "new."
Yeah?

I cannot thank you enough for giving me a new life
then, and a new way of thinking now.
(Master Shadow...)

Thank you for giving me the chance to move forward
with my future.

I don't really know what you mean, but you're
welcome...?

(Maybe I don't need to tease myself for being
sentimental about picturing a future where we
talk like we're students in love.)

I will cherish the last remnants of the feelings that
I can't get rid of.
I will move forward.

Declaring this she takes another step forward,
her expression brighter than ever.
